page.title: 05TRANSPORT IN BUCKHURST HILL
page.content: The roads in this area have two main purposes,a) to move traffic in & out of London,b)local use.There are two roads which deal with the first.the A11 goes from London to Newmarket. It is an old coaching road,so has a number of old coaching inns,such as the Horse & Wells pub at Woodford.It is busy road carrying mostly cars as the heavy traffic now goes on the M11.The motorway runs parallel to the A11 up to Cambridge.It runs along the R.Roding Valley. Running in between these two roads is the under ground central line.We have 3 stations in our block.B-Hill, R.Roding & Chigwell.This service is used alot by commuters & causes problems with car parking, especially in Queens Rd in B.Hill.Buses run regulary,though fares are expensive.
